References
==================

[Text]

* Adorni B., 1889: *Le grandi Fabbriche e la città: fortezze e palazzi di corte dei Farnese a Parma e Piacenza*, Publications de l'École Française de Rome, 439-449
* Hassan, A. T., Fritsch, D., 2019: *Integration of Laser Scanning and Photogrammetry in 3D/4D Cultural Heritage Preservation–A Review*. International Journal of Applied Science and Technology, 9(4), doi.org/10.30845/ijast.v9n4p9
* La Guardia, M., Koeva, M., D’Ippolito, F., and Karam, S., 2022: *3D data integration for web based open source WebGL interactive visualisation*, Int. Arch. Photogramm. Remote Sens. Spatial Inf. Sci., XLVIII-4/W4-2022, 89–94, doi.org/10.5194/isprs-archives-XLVIII-4-W4-2022-89-2022
* Schuetz, M., 2016: *Potree: Rendering Large Point Clouds in Web Browsers*. Master’s thesis, Technische Universitat Wien
* Vennarucci, R., Fredrick, D., Tanasi, D., Reynolds, N., Kingsland, K., Jenkins, B., Hassam, S., 2021: *In Ersilia's Footsteps: Toward an Interactive WebGL Application for Exploring the Villa Romana del Casale at Piazza Armerina, Sicily*. The 26th International Conference on 3D Web Technology, 1-7, doi.org/10.1145/3485444.3487646
* Westoby, M. J., Brasington, J., Glasser, N. F., Hambrey, M. J., Reynolds, J. M., 2012: *‘Structure-from-Motion’ photogrammetry: A low-cost, effective tool for geoscience applications*. Geomorphology, 179, 300-314, doi.org/10.1016/j.geomorph.2012.08
